alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Lincoln; Natrona; Park; Sublette; Sweetwater; Teton; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 04 at 11:44AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Cool Wet Pattern Continues Chances for Isolated Flooding and Flash Flooding... Localized flooding and flash flooding continues at the end of this week due to an active and moist storm track. High values of precipitable water (moisture) are presently over western, central, and northern Wyoming and are expected to continue through the weekend. Highest rain totals are expected across western and northern Wyoming. Impacts will be caused by locally moderate to heavy rain, continuous rain as a result of slow moving storms, or multiple rounds of rain in a row (training storms). Any of these options could bring high rainfall amounts and could result in localized flooding or increased stream flows. Rainfall rates of 1-3 inches per hour are possible. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Hilly terrain and backcountry roads in the foothills can be affected by increased stream flows due to increased rainfall and runoff. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
